definition: lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
deep/depth/deeply/(of a color) dark/deep/rich
to plan/to seek/scheme
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
to distance oneself from (classical)
to think over/to consider/anxiety

sentences.english: In the end, wisdom and forethought will win.
sentences.chinese: 有了智慧和深謀遠慮，最終纔會贏得勝利。

sentences.english: He had the foresight to invest his money carefully.
If you had had more foresight you would have saved yourself a lot of trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你當時深謀遠慮你就不會有那麼多麻煩了。

sentences.english: Provident men lay aside money for their families.
sentences.chinese: 深謀遠慮的人爲家庭貯蓄錢財。

definition: to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
magnanimous
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
(false) bravado/to bluff
to be strict with oneself
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
competitive/ambitious and aggressive/to desire to beat others
compassion/empathetic
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
